name: Selenium
description: Browser automation for web UI tests, well-established.

name: Postman
description: API testing and monitoring, widely used and easy to adopt.

name: Bruno
description: Open-source API client with local Git-based workflow, CLI runner, and JS scripting.

name: Insomnia
description: Open-source API client, usable offline, Inso CLI for automation, JS test scripts.

name: REST-assured
description: Java DSL for API testing (JUnit/TestNG), fully local, ideal for backend tests.

name: JUnit
description: Classic unit testing framework for Java.

name: Mockito
description: Standard mocking library for Java.

name: Jest
description: JavaScript/TypeScript testing framework with built-in mocking, assertions, and snapshot testing.

name: ArchUnit
description: Java architecture testing library to verify architectural rules and constraints.

name: Shift-Left Testing
description: Early testing in the development process to reduce costs and time-to-market.

name: Testcontainers
description: Java/Node library that spins up databases, message brokers, etc., via Docker for integration tests.

name: LocalStack
description: Local emulation of AWS services using Docker containers for API and infrastructure testing.

name: MockServer
description: HTTP/HTTPS mocking and proxying deployed via Docker containers, ideal for independent API tests.

name: Playwright
description: Next-gen browser automation with built-in multi-browser support.

name: Cucumber
description: Tool for Behavior-Driven Development using Gherkin syntax, supports automated test runs.

name: Behavior-Driven Development
description: Technique translating requirements into readable Gherkin feature files and promoting collaboration between business and tech teams.

name: JMeter
description: Performance and load testing for web services.

name: k6
description: JavaScript-based performance and load testing runner with a Go core, low footprint, and excellent CLI.

name: Contract Testing (Pact)
description: Contract tests between microservices to reduce integration breakages.

name: Cypress
description: End-to-end testing framework tightly integrated with JavaScript stacks.

name: Gatling
description: Code-based performance testing with a Scala DSL.

name: Kubernetes
description: Orchestration of containerized test and staging environments.

name: Terraform
description: Infrastructure-as-Code for provisioning consistent test environments in public/private clouds.

name: Ansible
description: Configuration management and provisioning for test VMs or containers using declarative playbooks.

name: BrowserStack
description: Cloud-based platform for cross-browser and cross-device testing of web and mobile UIs.

name: Helm
description: Package manager for Kubernetes to manage deployment templates and versioned charts.

name: Jira XRay
description: Test management add-on for Jira to manage test cases, plans, and execution reports.

name: Visual Regression Testing (Percy)
description: Screenshot comparison to detect visual changes in UI tests.

name: WireMock
description: HTTP stub/mock server for API tests, simulating complex response scenarios and fault conditions.

name: Chaos Engineering
description: Technique to inject failures (e.g., network latency, service restarts) into systems to validate resilience.

name: Test-Driven Development
description: Write tests before implementation to drive design, ensure coverage, and catch defects early.

name: Clean Code
description: Guidelines and practices for writing maintainable, readable, and efficient code.

name: Code Reviews
description: Peer review process to analyze code changes, catch defects, and improve code quality.

name: AI-based Code Reviews
description: Automated code review using AI/ML to detect issues, suggest improvements, and enforce standards.

name: DataFaker
description: Java library for generating realistic fake data (names, addresses, numbers) for testing.

name: Instancio
description: Java object generator that automatically populates POJOs with random data for tests.
